title: Newly Rebuilt Craftsman Perched Above San Francisco Bay
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Belvedere, California

Price: $7.95 million

Perched above the San Francisco Yacht Club, this newly rebuilt home offers sweeping views of San Francisco Bay as well as a custom funicular-style "hillavator" to transport residents up the home’s dramatic hillside from its garage and parking area.

The Beach Road house, a Craftsman that dates to 1914, is in the unincorporated city of Belvedere, "one of Marin County’s most exclusive enclaves of homes," listing agent Carolyn Adducci said.

Belvedere is attracting a lot of buyers from San Francisco, she said. "A lot of these executives work from home and they travel a lot. They don’t want to live in the city anymore."

"You get more for your money in Marin County and it’s a lifestyle," she added. "People who live in Belvedere stay a very long time."

If you want to live above absolutely EVERYONE else in San Francisco, you'll need to pay $46 million.https://t.co/W55rQweiNG — Mansion Global (@MansionGlobal) October 20, 2019

The San Francisco Yacht Club, which is just across the street from the house, is "one of the top five yacht clubs in the country," Ms. Adducci said.

"It is a very social club and a gathering place for the residents of Belvedere," she said.

Owner/developer Joseph Root, CEO of Cottage Coastal Builders and former CEO of the Big Island resort of Kohanaiki in Hawaii, has been at the helm of this project since he first discovered the property in 2016, she said.

Once the house was opened up, "they realized they couldn’t save a whole lot," Ms. Adducci said. "It’s newly rebuilt, down to the studs.

It has a "new foundation, a new roof, new plumbing, new electricity—new everything," she said.

"They kept the house’s classic features" and went current with the colors, the cabinetry, the countertops and the tiles, she said. "It has that feeling of a tasteful historic home."

Architectural and design features include original corbels, panoramic floor-to-ceiling windows and sliding glass doors, wide-plank white oak flooring, custom cabinetry throughout and a fireplace with Calacatta marble in a herringbone design.

More: Tech Couple List Their Eclectic Mansion on San Francisco’s Gold Coast for $39 Million

The ceiling heights are "very generous," Ms. Adducci said. "In the main living area they are 10 feet."

The master bedroom has doors that slide into the wall, so it can be opened up completely.

The custom kitchen features quartz countertops, stained rift oak wood cabinets and Thermador appliances. The master bathroom features Kauri diagonal porcelain tile and a freestanding tub overlooking the balcony with direct views of the water.

"The house flows very well," Ms. Adducci said. "It’s very open, very current."

It has a lot of privacy, she added. "It has a very large side yard, which is landscaped and fenced."

Further, it has the "most breathtaking views of the picturesque Yacht Harbor and Bay I have seen," Ms. Adducci said.

The main view is the harbor, she said. "You’re looking at the San Francisco Yacht Club marina and Angel Island and the Bay and Corinthian Island."

More: A Guide to the Season’s New Developments

Stats

The 4,020-square-foot house has five bedrooms, four full bathrooms and one partial bathroom.

Amenities

Amenities include a one-car garage, a fireplace, an ipe wood deck, a temperature-controlled wine room and the custom "hillavator" that holds up to four people.

From Penta: Porsche Debuts a More Affordable Taycan—and Plans a Plug-In Plane

Neighborhood Notes

From this house, "you can walk to town—it’s very close," Ms. Adducci said. It’s about a 10- to 15-minute walk to a "whole array of restaurants."

It’s also about a 15-minute walk to the ferry to downtown San Francisco, she said.

There are a lot of public walkways and parks in Belvedere, "so you see lots of hikers," she added.

Agents: Carolyn Adducci and Steve Marsh, Compass
